FuncDef: The monitor command monitors the physical status of E1 links to ensure correct link connections.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
Currently, only the trunk-serial and Global-Mp-Group interfaces are supported.

Specifies the interval for displaying statistics about traffic on the interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds. The default value is 10.

Specifies the number of times to display statistics about traffic on the interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9999. The default value is 5.

Examples: <HUAWEI> monitor e1 trunk-serial 0/1:0 interval 10 time 1Monitor the physical status of serial port at the interval of 10 seconds for up to 1 times. Press Ctrl + C to stop.
|  CPOS   E1:CH Status  Time    | Abort   Long  Short    CRC|Packet|Link Status     Time    |IP Status               Time
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Monitoring the physical status of E1 links can help you locate E1 link faults, ensuring correct link connections. You can configure the system to monitor the physical status of multiple E1 links simultaneously, not affecting existing services.
Configuration Impact
When the E1 link is monitored, the actual interval for displaying statistics on the interface may be different from the configured value of interval because of device status.
